main event: A bright white object, brighter than a star, was observed for about 20 minutes at Hallett Station in Antarctica on June 7, 1962.
interesting points: The object was sighted on a true bearing of approximately 010 degrees and was observed for more than 8 minutes.
The object appeared to be approximately 10 degrees in elevation.
The object was described as a steady white light in the atmosphere.
The reported size of the object and the duration of its observation are very unusual for this area.
No photographs were obtained of the sighting.
sighted object: a bright white object, brighter than a star
